categories.name: False Hierarchy
categories.scanDescription: Unequal button styling - accept is large/bright, decline is small/muted. IMPORTANT: Return the selector of the LESS prominent element (the decline/reject button that needs fixing)
categories.fixInstructions: Style the less prominent button to match the prominent one: same size, padding, font-weight, and colors. Example: el.style.cssText = 'padding: 12px 24px; font-size: 16px; font-weight: bold; background: #007AFF; color: white;'

categories.name: Hidden Information
categories.scanDescription: Critical info concealed - requires clicking, scrolling, or nearly invisible
categories.fixInstructions: Increase visibility: set opacity to 1, increase font-size, improve contrast. Example: el.style.cssText = 'opacity: 1; font-size: 14px; color: #333;'

categories.name: Confirmshaming
categories.scanDescription: Guilt-trip decline text - e.g. "No, I don't want to save on future purchases"
categories.fixInstructions: CRITICAL: Replace ONLY the guilt-trip TEXT, keep buttons/links functional. If element has NO children: el.textContent = 'No thanks'. If element HAS children (inputs/icons): use el.childNodes.forEach(n => { if (n.nodeType === 3 && n.textContent.trim()) n.textContent = 'No thanks'; }); NEVER use remove() or display:none on buttons.

categories.name: Forced Action
categories.scanDescription: Fake urgency - countdown timers, "Only 3 left!", scarcity messages
categories.fixInstructions: Hide urgency elements (timers, scarcity messages) but don't remove action buttons. Example: el.style.display = 'none';

categories.name: Trick Questions
categories.scanDescription: Confusing wording - double negatives like "Uncheck to not receive emails"
categories.fixInstructions: CRITICAL: (1) PRESERVE SEMANTICS - reword for clarity but keep EXACT same meaning. (2) Only modify TEXT NODES: el.childNodes.forEach(n => { if (n.nodeType === 3) n.textContent = '...'; }); Example: 'Uncheck to not opt out' = checked means opt-out â†’ reword to 'Opt out of marketing' (checkbox meaning unchanged). NEVER invert the logic.

categories.name: Preselected Options
categories.scanDescription: Pre-checked checkboxes for marketing or data sharing
categories.fixInstructions: Uncheck pre-selected checkboxes. Example: el.checked = false;
